body:
Comment 9: 
Re #8, I know many ways to solve the problem:

1. build with MinGW32/64 + Go source
2. unzip go1.1.1.windows-386.zip/go1.1.1.windows-amd64.zip
3. install go1.1.1.windows-386.msi/go1.1.1.windows-amd64.msi

my question is not ask how to cross compilation with Windows32/64.

I just suggest the msi include 386/amd64 together will more better.

You said windows Go users don't need cross compilation capabilities.
I agree with you.

I also don't like build win32 target.
But lots of target customer use win32, they need win32 target.

I hate the way to use MinGW build Go from source to solve the problem.
It doesn't mean i hate the MinGW as C toolchain.

we should not depend on MinGW just beacause it is a Go's C source toolchain.
Just like we should not depend on python/hg in windows distribution
(they are also the Go codereview toolchain).
